verses.text: And these \add are the countries\add* which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance to them.
By lot \add was\add* their inheritance, as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded by the hand of Moses, for the nine tribes, and \add for\add* the half tribe.
For Moses had given the inheritance of two tribes and a half tribe on the \add other\add* side Jordan: but unto the Levites he gave none inheritance among them.

For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim: therefore they gave no part unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell \add in\add*, with their suburbs for their cattle and for their substance.
As the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did, and they divided the land.

Then the children of Judah came unto Joshua in Gilgal: and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite said unto him, Thou knowest the thing that the \sc Lord\sc* said unto Moses the man of God concerning me and thee in Kadesh-barnea.
Forty years old \add was\add* I when Moses the servant of the \sc Lord\sc* sent me from Kadesh-barnea to espy out the land; and I brought him word again as \add it was\add* in mine heart.
Nevertheless my brethren that went up with me made the heart of the people melt: but I wholly followed the \sc Lord\sc* my God.

And Moses sware on that day, saying, Surely the land whereon thy feet have trodden shall be thine inheritance, and thy childrenâ€™s for ever, because thou hast wholly followed the \sc Lord\sc* my God.

And now behold, the \sc Lord\sc* hath kept me alive, as he said, these forty and five years, \add even\add* since the \sc Lord\sc* spake this word unto Moses, while \add the children of\add* Israel wandered in the wilderness: and now lo, I \add am this\add* day fourscore and five years old.

As yet I \add am as\add* strong \add this\add* day as \add I was\add* in the day that Moses sent me: as my strength \add was\add* then, even so \add is\add* my strength now, for war, both to go out, and to come in.

Now therefore give me this mountain, whereof the \sc Lord\sc* spake in that day; for thou heardest in that day how the Anakims \add were\add* there, and \add that\add* the cities \add were\add* great \add and\add* fenced: if so be the \sc Lord\sc* \add will be\add* with me, then I shall \add be able to\add* drive them out, as the \sc Lord\sc* said.
And Joshua blessed him, and gave unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh Hebron for an inheritance.
Hebron therefore became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite unto this day, because that he wholly followed the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel.
And the name of Hebron before \add was\add* Kirjath-arba; which \add Arba was\add* a great man among the Anakims. And the land had rest from war.
